weather_report:
As the evening settles over Downtown San Francisco, the sky offers a crisp clarity, inviting those below to step out and embrace the cool air. The current temperature hovers around the mid-forties, a gentle chill that nudges one toward layers—perhaps a woolen scarf or a light jacket—to ward off the evening breeze. The east-northeast winds, playful at times, rustle through the streets, hinting at transitions both in temperature and time. 

Looking ahead to tomorrow, the day promises a mostly sunny disposition, though a modest drop in temperature is anticipated as the afternoon progresses. While highs will flirt with fifty-eight degrees, the fall to around fifty-six may beckon a mid-layer. The absence of fog allows the landmarks of the city to stand in sharp relief against the bright backdrop, making this a fine opportunity for a leisurely stroll along the waterfront or a visit to one of the local cafes that dot the neighborhoods. Whether one chooses to wander through Golden Gate Park or enjoy the stillness of a quiet street with a warm drink in hand, the weather invites simple pleasures without the burden of overwhelming chill or dampness. A lovely evening awaits, promising clarity both in the air and the heart.
